result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary D Ewing was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program but IS eligible
for Substance Abue Program.

miscConds.notes:
Court Costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.

timeConds.notes: Condition Time - With Huber. Last 60 days STAYED and to be used at Agent's discretion as well as to the huber or straight time.

judgments.dispoDesc: strike the Second and Subsequent Offense enhancer

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gary D Ewing in court with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kuhary requests pleas date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Defendant Gary D Ewing in court with attorney Craig Michael Kuhary.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 9, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Gary D Ewing in court with attorney Breanna Bucher for Atty. Craig Michael Kuhary.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Gary D Ewing in court.  Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant to requesting the court to appoint counsel. Court grants and the defendant is to reimburse the county at the rate of $50.00 a month commencing 06/15/2015 and every month thereafter. Time limits are tolled for the preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.   Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Gary D Ewing in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court advises of right to an attorney.   Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.
